page.title: 17Billing Aquadrome
page.content: A private firm bought the land on which the Aquadrome is now built 57 years ago. The land was originally worked as gravel pits. They decided to turn the entire area into a pleasure centre. It was began by Mr.A.J.Mackaness, the proprietor of the gravel workings in 1928. Development has been steady, lots of trees have been planted and the area landscaped. During the last 5 years growth has really sped up. Facilities offered are:- restaurants, shopping entre, fairs and amusements, kiosks, ars, swimming pools, swings and play- grounds, seasonal caravans, walks around the lakes, a milling museum, a yachting centre, permanent caravans and holiday homes, everything in the camping and caravan line is provided.
